pullRequest.body:
Define the convex closed hull and the absolutely convex closed hull and prove basic properties.

See e.g. Bourbaki, TVS II.13

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ AbsConvex.closure`
`+ absConvexHull_subseteq_convexClosedHull`
`+ absConvex_closed_sInter`
`+ absConvex_convexClosedHull`
`+ closedAbsConvexHull`
`+ closedAbsConvexHull_eq_closedAbsConvexHull_closure`
`+ closedAbsConvexHull_eq_closure_absConvexHull`
`+ closedAbsConvexHull_min`
`+ closedConvexHull`
`+ closedConvexHull_eq_closedConvexHull_closure`
`+ closedConvexHull_eq_closure_convexHull`
`+ closedConvexHull_min`
`+ closure_subset_closedConvexHull`
`+ convexHull_subseteq_closedConvexHull`
`+ convex_closedConvexHull`
`+ convex_closed_sInter`
`+ isClosed_closedAbsConvexHull`
`+ isClosed_closedConvexHull`
`+ subset_closedAbsConvexHull`
`+ subset_closedConvexHull`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
@ADedecker would you like to review this one as well please?

```suggestion
theorem convexClosedHull_min {s t : Set E} (hst : s  t) (h_conv : Convex  t) (h_closed : IsClosed t) :
```

The adjective order here is backwards from what is standard in English (as confirmed by [ngram](https://books.google.com/ngrams/graph?content=closed+convex+hull%2C+convex+closed+hull&year_start=1800&year_end=2022&corpus=en&smoothing=3)), and is doubly justified by the fact that the closed convex hull is `closure (convexHull  s)` which is in general distinct from `convexHull  (closure s)` unless `closure s` is compact.
```suggestion
def closedConvexHull : ClosureOperator (Set E) := .ofCompletePred (fun s => Convex  s  IsClosed s)
```
It probably makes sense to move the entire section on closed convex hulls below `Convex.closure`, especially because this is *the* key lemma.

Same reasoning, this should be:
```suggestion
def closedAbsConvexHull : ClosureOperator (Set E) :=
```

I think you also want:
```lean
theorem closure_subset_convexClosedHull {s : Set E} : closure s  convexClosedHull  s :=
  sorry
```

There should be a much simpler proof using the lemma I just mentioned along the lines of:
```
convexClosedHull  s  convexClosedHull  (closure s)  convexClosedHull  (convexClosedHull  s) = convexClosedHull  s
```
The first is `ClosureOperator.monotone`, the second is the lemma I just mentioned, and the third is `ClosureOperator.idempotent`, which is a `simp` lemma. So, something like (untested) should work:
```suggestion
theorem convexClosedHull_eq_convexClosedHull_closure {s : Set E} :
    convexClosedHull  s = convexClosedHull  (closure s) :=
  subset_antisymm ((convexClosedHull ).monotone subset_closure) <| by
    simpa using ((convexClosedHull ).monotone closure_subset_convexClosedHull)
```
As above, you want the `closure s  _` lemma.
Here the proof can be simplified the same way.

pullRequest.title: feature(Analysis/Convex/Topology): convex closed hull
